intro: Lasianthus graciliflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
